DevicesÔÉÅ

The following are the devices currently implemented in the tool.
Devices are defined as python functions which apply Pyomo Param, Var, Port and Constraint to a Block.
These functions are structured as follows:
def Name(b, [t], data, init_data):

        # Parameters. Values set by `data`

        # Variables. Values initialized by `init_data`

        # Ports

        # Constraints
Here is an example of the definition of a PQ load device:
def PQ_Load(b, data, init_data):

        # Parameters
        b.P = pyo.Param(initialize=data['P'])
        b.Q = pyo.Param(initialize=data['Q'])

        # Variables
        b.S = pyo.Var(initialize=init_data['S'], within=pyo.Reals)

        # Ports
        b.port_P = Port(initialize={'P': (b.P, Port.Extensive)})
        b.port_Q = Port(initialize={'Q': (b.Q, Port.Extensive)})
        b.port_S = Port(initialize={'S': (b.S, Port.Extensive)})

        # Constraints
        def Constraint_S(_b):
                return _b.P**2 + _b.Q**2 == _b.S**2
        b.c_S = pyo.Constraint(rule=Constraint_S)

They are meant to be called after defining a Block object as follows:

some_load = pyo.Block()
data = {'P':10e6, 'Q':2e6}
init_data = {'S':0}
PQ_Load(some_load, data, init_data)

Note

It is required to import the pyomo libraries and the corresponding devices‚Äô files:

# Import pyomo
import pyomo.environ as pyo
from pyomo.network import *

# Import devices
from Devices.Loads import PQ_Load

One may find the need to add time dependent variables and relations. In such case a Set is defined:

time_list = [1, 2, 3, 4, 5] # 5 time steps
t = pyo.Set(initialize=time_list)

and a t argument is added to the function as well as to its call

def PQ_Load(b, t, data, init_data):

        # Parameters
        b.P = pyo.Param(t, initialize=data['P'])
        b.Q = pyo.Param(t, initialize=data['Q'])

        # Variables
        b.S = pyo.Var(t, initialize=init_data['S'], within=pyo.Reals)

        # Ports
        b.port_P = Port(initialize={'P': (b.P, Port.Extensive)})
        b.port_Q = Port(initialize={'Q': (b.Q, Port.Extensive)})
        b.port_S = Port(initialize={'S': (b.S, Port.Extensive)})

        # Constraints
        def Constraint_S(_b, _t):
                return _b.P[_t]**2 + _b.Q[_t]**2 == _b.S[_t]**2
        b.c_S = pyo.Constraint(t, rule=Constraint_S)


some_load = pyo.Block()
data = {'P':[10e6,10e6,0,0,5e6] , 'Q':[2e6,1e6,0,0,0.5e6]}
init_data = {'S':[0, 0, 0, 0, 0]}
PQ_Load(some_load, t, data, init_data)

Hydro devicesÔÉÅ

This lists the devices related to hydro

SourceÔÉÅ

Source pyomo block contains characteristics of a source.

Devices.Sources.Source(b, t, data, init_data=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Basic Source.

Injects a given flow \(Q(t)\), behaving as the hydro analogous of a current source.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì None

data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Injected flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • Qin (t)

    • Qout (t)

  • Variables:

    • None

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout as Extensive

  • Constraints:

    • None

Devices.Sources.VarSource(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Undetermined flow Source.

Injects an undetermined flow \(Q(t)\), limited by \(Q_{max}\).

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì None

data

  • ‚ÄòQmin‚Äô: Minimum flow \(Q_{min}\) as a float (can be negative)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum flow \(Q_{max}\) as a float (can be negative)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Injected flow \(Q_{out}(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • Qmin

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \in [-Q_{max},-Q_{min}]\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \in [Q_{min},Q_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout as Extensive

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t)=-Q_{out}(t)\)

Hydro SwitchÔÉÅ

HydroSwitch pyomo block contains characteristics of a switch for pipe commutation.

Devices.HydroSwitch.HydroSwitch(b, t, data=None, init_data=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Hydraulic switch.

Computes the output flow \(Q_{out}(t)\) between 2 inputs of flow \(Q_{in,0}(t)\) and \(Q_{in,1}(t)\) , analogous of an electrical switch

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì None

  • init_data ‚Äì None

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • None

  • Variables:

    • Qin0 (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • Qin1 (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • Qout (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • Hin0 (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • Hin1 (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • Hout (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • b (t) \(\in \{0,1\}\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin0 @ Qin0 as Extensive

    • port_Qin1 @ Qin1 as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout as Extensive

    • port_Hin0 @ Hin0 as Equality

    • port_Hin1 @ Hin1 as Equality

    • port_Hout @ Hout as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_State: \(Q_{in,0}(t) \, Q_{in,1}(t) = 0\)

    • c_Qout: \(- Q_{out}(t) + Q_{in,0}(t) + Q_{in,1}(t) = 0\)

    • c_Hout: \(- H_{out}(t) + H_{in,1}(t) \, b(t) + H_{in,0}(t) \, (1-b(t)) = 0\)

    • c_Qin0: \(Q_{in,0}(t) \, H_{in,1}(t) \, b(t) = 0\)

    • c_Qin1: \(Q_{in,1}(t) \, H_{in,0}(t) \, (1-b(t)) = 0\)

See also

Switch

New PumpÔÉÅ

NewPump pyomo block contains characteristics of a pump to size.

Devices.NewPumps.NewPump(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Sizing of a new pump‚Äôs nominal power \(P_{dim}\)

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\) as a float

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • eff

  • Variables:

    • Pdim bounded \(P_{dim} \ge 0\)

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \le 0\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \ge 0\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \ge 0\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \ge 0\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)/\eta\)

    • c_Pdim: \(P_{dim}(t) \ge P_e(t)\)

PipesÔÉÅ

Pipe pyomo block contains characteristics of a pipe.

Devices.Pipes.Pipe(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Pipe that transports water and has implicit energy losses.

Acts as a flow transportation device which also applies an energy loss to the fluid as:

\[H(t) = H_0(t) \pm K \, Q(t)^2\]

where \(H_0(t)\) is the static height and is computed as the difference of heights between both pipe extremes.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòK‚Äô: Linear pressure loss coefficient of the pipe \(K\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow \(Q_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚Äòzlow‚Äô: Lower height \(z_{low}(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚Äòzhigh‚Äô: Higher height \(z_{high}(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • K

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Q (t) bounded \(\in [-Q_{max}, Q_{max}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • zlow (t) bounded \(z_{low} \ge 0\)

    • zhigh (t) bounded \(z_{high} \ge 0\)

    • Qp(t) bounded \(Q_p \in [0, Q_{max}]\)

    • Qn(t) bounded \(Q_n \in [0, Q_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Q @ Q as Extensive

    • port_H @ H as Equality

    • port_zlow @ zlow as Equality

    • port_zhigh @ zhigh as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_H: \(H(t) = z_{high}(t)-z_{low}(t) + K (Q_p(t)^2 - Q_n(t)^2)\)

    • c_Q: \(Q(t)= Qp(t) - Qn(t)\)

    • c_QpQn0: :math:`0 = Qp(t),Qn(t)

Devices.Pipes.PipeValve(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Pipe that transports water and has implicit energy losses.

Acts as a flow transportation device which also applies an energy loss to the fluid and considers the aperture \(a(t)\) of a valve as:

\[H(t) = H_0(t) \pm (K + C_v/a(t) )\, Q(t)^2\]

where \(H_0(t)\) is the static height and is computed as the difference of heights between both pipe extremes.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòK‚Äô: Linear pressure loss coefficient of the pipe \(K\)

  • ‚ÄòCv‚Äô: Linear pressure loss coefficient of the valve \(C_{v}\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow \(Q_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚Äòzlow‚Äô: Lower height \(z_{low}(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚Äòzhigh‚Äô: Higher height \(z_{high}(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚Äòalpha‚Äô: Valve aperture \(a(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • K

    • Cv

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Q (t) bounded \(\in [-Q_{max}, Q_{max}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • zlow (t) bounded \(z_{low} \ge 0\)

    • zhigh (t) bounded \(z_{high} \ge 0\)

    • Qp (t) bounded \(\in [0, Q_{max}]\)

    • Qn (t) bounded \(\in [0, Q_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Q @ Q as Extensive

    • port_H @ H as Equality

    • port_zlow @ zlow as Equality

    • port_zhigh @ zhigh as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_H: \(H(t) = z_{high}(t)-z_{low}(t) + (K+C_v/a(t)) (Q_p(t)^2 - Q_n(t)^2)\)

    • c_Q: \(Q(t)= Qp(t) - Qn(t)\)

    • c_QpQn0: \(0 = Qp(t)\,Qn(t)\)

Devices.Pipes.Pipe_Ex0(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Simple Pipe for testing and example purposes. It is utilised in Example0.

Acts as a flow transportation device which also applies an energy loss to the fluid as:

\[H(t) = H_0 \pm K \cdot Q(t)^2\]

where \(H_0\) is the static height, which is considered constant as defined by the user.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòH0‚Äô: Static height \(H_0\)

  • ‚ÄòK‚Äô: Linear pressure loss coefficient of the pipe \(K\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow \(Q_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • H0

    • K

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Q (t) bounded \(\in [-Q_{max}, Q_{max}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • Qp (t) bounded \(\in [0, Q_{max}]\)

    • Qn (t) bounded \(\in [0, Q_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Q @ Q as Extensive

    • port_H @ H as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_H: \(H(t) = H_0 + K(Q_p(t)^2 - Q_n(t)^2)\)

    • c_Q: \(Q(t)= Qp(t) - Qn(t)\)

    • c_QpQn0: \(0 = Qp(t)\,Qn(t)\)

PumpsÔÉÅ

Pump pyomo block contains characteristics of a pump.

Devices.Pumps.DiscretePump(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

DiscretePump is the association of ‚ÄúN‚Äù pumps in parallel. Each individual pump have two state:

  1. ON consuming the nominal power.

  2. OFF.

The model allows for the activation of an integer number of pumps ranging from 0 to ‚ÄúN‚Äù. The total power consumed by the system is directly proportional to the number of pumps that are ON.

It‚Äôs introduced \(P_{n}\) wich is the individual nominal power of the pump and \(N_{pumps}\) the maximum number of pumps that can be associated.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòNpumps‚Äô: Maximum number of pumps to consider \(Npumps\)

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\)

  • ‚ÄòPn‚Äô: Nominal power of individual pump \(P_{n}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • eff

    • Pn

    • Npumps

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \leq 0\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \ge 0\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • N_on (t) \(b_{ON}(t) \in [0,N_{pumps}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_n \, N_{on}(t)\)

    • c_eff: \(P_e(t) = P_h / \eta\)

Devices.Pumps.LinealizedPump(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

In RealPump it‚Äôs added the working flow limits of the pump. Be wary of binary variables when choosing a solver.

It‚Äôs introduced \(Q_{max}\) and \(Q_{min}\) which determines the working limits.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòA‚Äô: Constant characteristic coefficient of the pump \(A\)

  • ‚ÄòB‚Äô: Quadratic characteristic coefficient of the pump \(B\)

  • ‚ÄòQnom‚Äô: Nominal flow \(Q_n\)

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow (in p.u. of Qnom) \(Q_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòQmin‚Äô: Minimum working flow (in p.u. of Qnom) \(Q_{min}\)

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed power \(P_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list

  • ‚Äòn‚Äô: Rotational speed (in p.u.) \(n(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • A

    • B

    • Qnom

    • eff

    • Qmin

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \in [-Q_{max}\,Q_{n}, 0]\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \in [0, Q_{max}\,Q_{n}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • npu2 (t) bounded \(n \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • PumpOn (t) \(b_{ON}(t) \in \{0,1\}\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_H: \(H(t) = (n(t)/n_n)^2\, A - B \, Q_{out}(t)^2\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)/\eta\)

    • c_Qmax: \(Q_{out}(t) \leq Q_{n} \, Q_{max} \, b_{ON}(t)\)

    • c_Qmin: \(Q_{out}(t) \geq Q_{n} \, Q_{min} \, b_{ON}(t)\)

Devices.Pumps.Pump(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Frequency controllable hydraulic pump.

Applies the hydraulic head equation to a flow, with the ability to change its rotational speed, limited by a maximum power:

\[H(t) = (n(t)/n_n)^2\, A - B \, Q(t)^2\]

with \(A\) and \(B\) the characteristic coefficients that define the behaviour of the pump (i.e its curve).

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòA‚Äô: Constant characteristic coefficient of the pump \(A\)

  • ‚ÄòB‚Äô: Quadratic characteristic coefficient of the pump \(B\)

  • ‚ÄòQnom‚Äô: Nominal flow \(Q_n\)

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow (in p.u. of Qnom) \(Q_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed power \(P_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list

  • ‚Äòn‚Äô: Rotational speed (in p.u.) \(n(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • A

    • B

    • Qnom

    • eff

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \in [-Q_{max}\,Q_{nom}, 0]\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \in [0, Q_{max}\,Q_{nom}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • npu2 (t) bounded \(n \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \in [0, P_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_H: \(H(t) = (n(t)/n_n)^2\, A - B \, Q_{out}(t)^2\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{out}\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)/\eta\)

Devices.Pumps.RealPump(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

In RealPump it‚Äôs added the working flow limits of the pump. Be wary of binary variables when choosing a solver.

It‚Äôs introduced \(Q_{max}\) and \(Q_{min}\) which determines the working limits.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòA‚Äô: Constant characteristic coefficient of the pump \(A\)

  • ‚ÄòB‚Äô: Quadratic characteristic coefficient of the pump \(B\)

  • ‚ÄòQnom‚Äô: Nominal flow \(Q_n\)

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\)

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow (in p.u. of Qnom) \(Q_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòQmin‚Äô: Minimum working flow (in p.u. of Qnom) \(Q_{min}\)

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed power \(P_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list

  • ‚Äòn‚Äô: Rotational speed (in p.u.) \(n(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • A

    • B

    • Qnom

    • eff

    • Qmin

    • Qmax

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \in [-Q_{max}\,Q_{n}, 0]\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \in [0, Q_{max}\,Q_{n}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • npu2 (t) bounded \(n \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • PumpOn (t) \(b_{ON}(t) \in \{0,1\}\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_H: \(H(t) = (n(t)/n_n)^2\, A - B \, Q_{out}(t)^2\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)/\eta\)

    • c_Qmax: \(Q_{out}(t) \leq Q_{n} \, Q_{max} \, b_{ON}(t)\)

    • c_Qmin: \(Q_{out}(t) \geq Q_{n} \, Q_{min} \, b_{ON}(t)\)

Devices.Pumps.RealPumpControlled(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

In RealPumpControlled, three working regimes are added depending on the height (z) between the surfaces of the reservoirs.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòA‚Äô: Constant characteristic coefficient of the pump \(A\)

  • ‚ÄòB‚Äô: Quadratic characteristic coefficient of the pump \(B\)

  • ‚Äòn_n‚Äô: Nominal rotational speed \(n_n\)

  • ‚ÄòQnom‚Äô: Nominal flow \(Q_n\)

  • ‚ÄòQmin‚Äô: Minimum flow \(Q_{min}\)

  • ‚ÄòQbep‚Äô: Final BEP flow \(Q_{bep}\)

  • ‚ÄòQpmax‚Äô: Final Pmax flow \(Q_{pmax}\)

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency at the nominal operating point in p.u. \(\eta\)

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed power \(P_{max}\)

  • ‚Äòzmin‚Äô: Minimum heigh that the pump can operate \(z_{min}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list

  • ‚Äòn‚Äô: Rotational speed \(n(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • A

    • B

    • Qnom

    • Qmin

    • Qbep

    • Qpmax

    • n_n

    • eff

    • zmin

  • Variables:

    • Qin (t) bounded \(Q_{in} \in [-Q_{max}, 0]\)

    • Qout (t) bounded \(Q_{out} \in [0, Q_{max}]\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • n (t) bounded \(n \ge 0\)

    • Ph (t) bounded \(P_h \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pe (t) bounded \(P_e \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • PumpOn (t) bounded \(PumpOn = [0,1]\)

    • aux (t) bounded \(aux = [0,1]\)

    • Qcontrol (t) bounded \(Q_{control} \in [Q_{min},{Q_{max}}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Qin @ Qin with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_Qout @ Qout with ‚ÄòQ‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_P @ Pe with ‚ÄòP‚Äô as Extensive

    • port_H @ H with ‚ÄòH‚Äô as Equality

  • Constraints:

    • c_Q: \(Q_{in}(t) = - Q_{out}(t)\)

    • c_H: \(H(t) = (n(t)/n_n)^2\cdot A - B \cdot Q_{out}(t)^2\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\cdot H(t)\cdot Q_{out}\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)/\eta\)

    • c_Qcontrol: \(Qout(t) = Qcontrol(t)\cdot PumpOn(t) \cdot aux(t)\)

    • c_Hmin1: \(H(t) \leq z_{min} \cdot aux(t)\)

    • c_Hmin2: \(z_{min} \leq H(t) \cdot (1 - aux(t))\)

    • c_Binary: \(PumpOn(t) + aux(t) = 1\)

    • c_Piecewise: \(Q = egin{cases} Q_{min} & ext{if} z{1} \le z \le z{2}\ Q_{bep} & ext{if} z{2} \le z \le z{3}\ Q_{pmax} & ext{if} z{3} \le z \le z{4} \end{cases}\)

ReservoirsÔÉÅ

Reservoir pyomo block containing the characteristics of a reservoir.

Devices.Reservoirs.Reservoir(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Simple Reservoir.

Modifies its volume state \(W(t)\) and height \(z(t)\) from an initial state \(W_0\) according to the aggregated input flows \(Q(t)\)

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚Äòdt‚Äô: Time delta \(\Delta t\)

  • ‚ÄòW0‚Äô: Initial volume \(W_0\)

  • ‚ÄòWmin‚Äô: Minimum allowed volume \(W_{min}\)

  • ‚ÄòWmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed volume \(W_{max}\)

  • ‚Äòzmin‚Äô: Height at minimum volume \(z_{min}\)

  • ‚Äòzmax‚Äô: Height at maximum volume \(z_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòWT_min‚Äô: Minimum allowed volume at t=T \(W_{min,T}\) (optional)

  • ‚ÄòWT_max‚Äô: Maximum allowed volume at t=T \(W_{max,T}\) (optional)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòW‚Äô: Volume \(W(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • W0

    • Wmin

    • Wmax

    • zmin

    • zmax

  • Variables:

    • Q (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • W (t) bounded \(W \in [W_{min},W_{max}]\) and \(W(T) \in [W_{min,T},W_{max,T}]\)

    • z (t) bounded \(z \in [z_{min},z_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Q @ Q as Extensive

    • port_z @ z as Equality

  • Constraints:
    • c_W:

      • \(W(t) = W(t-1) + \Delta t \, Q(t) \quad\) if \(t>0\)

      • \(W(t) = W_0 + \Delta t \, Q(t) \quad\) otherwise

    • c_z: \(z(t) = (W(t) - W_{min})/(W_{max} - W_{min})\,(z_{max}-z_{min}) + z_{min}\)

Devices.Reservoirs.Reservoir_Ex0(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Simple Reservoir for testing and example purposes. It is utilised in Example0.

Modifies its volume state \(W(t)\) from an initial state \(W_0\) according to the aggregated input flows \(Q(t)\)

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data

  • ‚ÄòW0‚Äô: Initial volume \(W_0\)

  • ‚ÄòWmin‚Äô: Minimum allowed volume \(W_{min}\)

  • ‚ÄòWmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed volume \(W_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòQ‚Äô: Flow \(Q(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòW‚Äô: Volume \(W(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • W0

  • Variables:

    • Q (t) \(\in \mathbb{R}\)

    • W (t) bounded \(W \in [W_{min},W_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_Q @ Q (Extensive)

  • Constraints:
    • c_W:

      • \(W(t) = W(t-1) + Q(t) \quad\) if \(t>0\)

      • \(W(t) = W_0 + Q(t) \quad\) otherwise

Turbine.

Sizes a new turbine.

Parameters:

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

  • ‚ÄòQmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed flow \(Q_{max}\)

init_data

  • ‚ÄòH‚Äô: Head \(H(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

  • ‚ÄòPe‚Äô: Electrical power \(P_e(t)\) as a list or pandas Series

Pyomo declarations

    • eff

    • Pmax

  • Variables:

    • Pdim bounded \(P_{dim} \ge 0\)

    • H (t) bounded \(H \ge 0\)

    • c_Ph: \(P_h(t) = 9810\, H(t)\, Q_{in}(t)\)

    • c_Pe: \(P_e(t) = P_h(t)\, \eta\)

    • c_Pdim: \(P_{dim} \ge -P_e(t)\)

Solar PVÔÉÅ

SolarPV pyomo block contains characteristics of a solar PV plant.

Devices.SolarPV.SolarPV(b, t, data, init_data=None)[source]ÔÉÅ

Expandable solar PV plant.

Delivers power subject to a forecast \(f(t)\) and its installed power \(P_{inst}\). The plant will be able to expand up to a \(P_{max}\).

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì None

data

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed power to be installed \(P_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòPinst‚Äô: Installed power \(P_{inst}\)

  • ‚Äòforecast‚Äô: Forecast as power in p.u. \(f(t)\) as a list

  • ‚Äòeff‚Äô: Efficiency of the PV panels \(\eta\)

Pyomo declarations
  • Parameters:

    • Pmax

    • Pinst

    • forecast

    • eff

  • Variables:

    • P (t) bounded \(P(t) \in [-P_{max}, 0]\)

    • Pdim bounded \(P_{dim} \in [0, P_{max}-P_{inst}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_P @ P as Extensive

  • Constraints:

    • c_P: \(P(t) \ge -(P_{inst}+P_{dim})\, f(t)\, \eta\)

Electrical switch.

Battery pyomo block containing the characteristics of a battery.

Devices.Batteries.Battery(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Simple Battery for testing and example purposes. It is used in Example21.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

data:

  • ‚Äòdt‚Äô: time step \(\Delta t\)

  • ‚ÄòE0‚Äô: Initial energy \(E_0\)

  • ‚ÄòSOCmin‚Äô: Minimum allowed SOC \(SOC_{min}\) in p.u.

  • ‚ÄòSOCmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed SOC \(SOC_{max}\) in p.u.

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum delivered/absorbed power \(P_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòEmax‚Äô: Maximum battery energy \(E_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòPinst‚Äô: Power already installed \(P_{inst}\)

  • ‚ÄòEinst‚Äô: Energy storage already installed \(E_{inst}\)

  • ‚Äòeff_ch‚Äô: Effiency of charge \(\eta_{ch}\)

  • ‚Äòeff_dc‚Äô: Effiency of discharge \(\eta_{dc}\)

init_data:

  • ‚ÄòE‚Äô: Energy \(E(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòP‚Äô: Power \(P(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declaration
  • Parameters:

    • dt

    • E0

    • SOCmin

    • SOCmax

    • Pmax

    • Emax

    • Pinst

    • Einst

    • eff_ch

    • eff_dc

  • Variables:

    • E (t) bounded \(E(t) \in [0, E_{max}\, SOC_{max}]\)

    • P (t) bounded \(P(t) \in [-P_{max}, P_{max}]\)

    • Pch (t) bounded \(P_{ch}(t) \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pdc (t) bounded \(P_{dc}(t) \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • SOC (t) bounded \(SOC(t) \in [SOC_{min}, SOC_{max}]\)

    • Edim bounded \(E_{dim} \in [0, E_{max} - E_{inst}]\)

    • Pdim bounded \(P_{dim} \in [0, P_{max} - P_{inst}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_P @ P (Extensive)

  • Constraints:

    • c_P: \(P(t) = P_{ch}(t)\, \eta_{ch} - P_{disc}(t)\, \eta_{dc}\)

    • c_P0: \(0 = P_{ch}(t) \, P_{dc}(t)\)

    • c_SOC: \(SOC(t) = E(t) /(E_{dim}+E_{inst})\)

    • c_ch: \(P_{ch}(t) \leq (P_{inst} + P_{dim})\)

    • dc: \(P_{dc}(t) \leq (P_{inst} + P_{dim})\)

    • c_Emax: \(E(t) \leq (E{inst} + E{dim})\, SOC{max}\)

    • c_Emin: \(E(t) \geq (E{inst} + E{dim})\, SOC{min}\)

    • c_E:

      • \(E(t) = E(t-1) + \Delta t \, P(t) \quad\) if \(t>0\)

      • \(E(t) = E_0 + \Delta t \, P(t) \quad\) otherwise

Devices.Batteries.NewBattery(b, t, data, init_data)[source]ÔÉÅ

Battery set for sizing.

Parameters:

  • b ‚Äì pyomo Block() to be set

  • t ‚Äì pyomo Set() referring to time

  • data ‚Äì data dict

  • init_data ‚Äì init_data dict

  • ‚Äòdt‚Äô: time step \(\Delta t\)

  • ‚ÄòSOCmin‚Äô: Minimum allowed SOC \(SOC_{min}\) in p.u.

  • ‚ÄòSOCmax‚Äô: Maximum allowed SOC \(SOC_{max}\) in p.u.

  • ‚ÄòPmax‚Äô: Maximum delivered/absorbed power \(P_{max}\)

  • ‚ÄòEmax‚Äô: Maximum battery energy \(E_{max}\)

  • ‚Äòeff_ch‚Äô: Effiency of charge \(\eta_{ch}\)

  • ‚Äòeff_dc‚Äô: Effiency of discharge \(\eta_{dc}\)

init_data:

  • ‚ÄòE‚Äô: Energy \(E(t)\) as a list

  • ‚ÄòP‚Äô: Power \(P(t)\) as a list

Pyomo declaration
  • Parameters:

    • dt

    • SOCmin

    • SOCmax

    • Pmax

    • Emax

    • eff_ch

    • eff_dc

    • T

  • Variables:

    • E (t) bounded \(E(t) \in [0, E_{max}\, SOC_{max}]\)

    • P (t) bounded \(P(t) \in [-P_{max}, P_{max}]\)

    • Pch (t) bounded \(P_{ch}(t) \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • Pdc (t) bounded \(P_{dc}(t) \in [0, P_{max}]\)

    • SOC (t) bounded \(SOC(t) \in [SOC_{min}, SOC_{max}]\)

    • Edim bounded \(E_{dim} \in [0, E_{max}]\)

    • Pdim bounded \(P_{dim} \in [0, P_{max}]\)

  • Ports:

    • port_P @ P (Extensive)

  • Constraints:

    • c_P: \(P(t) = P_{ch}(t)\, \eta_{ch} - P_{disc}(t)/ \eta_{dc}\)

    • c_P0: \(0 = P_{ch}(t) \, P_{dc}(t)\)

    • c_SOC: \(SOC(t) = E(t) /(E_{dim}+E_{inst})\)

    • c_ch: \(P_{ch}(t) \leq (P_{inst} + P_{dim})\)

    • dc: \(P_{dc}(t) \leq (P_{inst} + P_{dim})\)

    • c_Emax: \(E(t) \leq (E{inst} + E{dim})\, SOC{max}\)

    • c_Emin: \(E(t) \geq (E{inst} + E{dim})\, SOC{min}\)

    • c_E:

      • \(E(t) = E(t-1) + \Delta t \, P(t) \quad\) if \(t>0\)

      • \(E(t) = E(T) + \Delta t \, P(t) \quad\) otherwise
